quantityRules.description: Single frog requires 30 gallons minimum (approximately 18×18×24"). Each additional frog requires 10 more gallons. Maximum 4 frogs per enclosure recommended to avoid overcrowding and competition.

careTargets.gradient: Warm zone at top (85-88°F for basking/digestion) with cooler areas below. Critical nighttime drop to 70-75°F mimics wild temperature fluctuations.

lifespan: 12-16 years in captivity, up to 20+ years with excellent care
notes: Known for their docile temperament and 'smiling' appearance
Nocturnal and crepuscular - active during dawn/dusk and throughout the night; rest in cool dark spots during day
Can become obese in captivity - monitor feeding carefully and provide dietary variety
Prefer horizontal perches over vertical climbing; rest on leaves and branches
Males vocalize loudly during breeding season (Nov-Feb in wild) - calls intensify after rain
Semi-arid species from dry Australian woodlands - thrive in warm, DRY conditions (NOT high humidity like many assume)
Feed at night in darkness for natural hunting enrichment and weight management

warnings.message: Obesity is a common health issue - do not overfeed.

HUMIDITY WARNING - Semi-arid species! Keep at 30-40% (NO HIGHER). DO NOT use misters/foggers - they increase humidity too much, promote bacterial growth, and cause respiratory infections. These frogs thrive in warm, DRY conditions.

HEATING SAFETY: NEVER use heat mats (burn risk + don't heat ambient air). Use ceramic heat emitter (CHE) or deep heat projector (DHP) with thermostat. Halogen bulbs good for daytime (emit IR-A for cellular-level warming). CHE/DHP emit no light so safe for nighttime use.

ENCLOSURE REQUIREMENT: GLASS or PVC ONLY with mesh/screen TOP (not sides). Screen enclosures are INCOMPATIBLE - cannot maintain stable warmth. Mesh top allows UVB/heat penetration and ventilation for low humidity. Glass/PVC sides retain necessary warmth. Min 24" height for arboreal climbing.

UVB REQUIRED: Use TUBE style (not compact) for even distribution. Complete darkness at night - NO colored bulbs (damage eyes/circadian rhythm). Day/night cycle critical for metabolic health and circadian rhythm. Temperature 85-88°F crucial for digestion.
WATER: Use tap water + reptisafe OR spring water. NEVER use distilled/RO water unless remineralized (reverse osmosis can leach minerals from frog). Fireflies are poisonous - never use as feeders.

SUBSTRATE WARNING: Avoid moss (retains moisture/bacteria, impaction risk if ingested). Use thick leaf litter layer over substrate to protect sensitive skin. Non-bioactive substrate must be changed monthly.
IMPORTANT: Provide multiple hides and climbing structures in UPPER areas of tank where they feel safest. They prefer horizontal perches over vertical branches.

BEGINNER NOTE: Despite common misinformation online (often from shops selling products), these are semi-arid frogs that need LOW humidity and warm/dry conditions. They are NOT high-humidity tropical frogs.
